meanings.definition: To inform against; denounce or accuse.
meanings.sent1: She was delating her friend for breaking the rules.
meanings.sent2: The witness decided to delate the suspect to the authorities.
meanings.sent3: The parrot was delating the cat's mischief to the owner.
meanings.sent4: The whistleblower bravely delated the corruption within the company.
meanings.sent5: The teacher caught the student delating on his classmates.

meanings.sent1: He delated the incident to the police immediately.
meanings.sent2: The journalist delated the details of the event in the newspaper.
meanings.sent3: The child was delating the funny story to his friends.
meanings.sent4: The historian delated the ancient ruins with great accuracy.
meanings.sent5: The explorer delated the breathtaking view from the mountaintop.
